What is contact with resistance?
... up to ... What is mind contact?
Such chapters,
and having understood the meaning of the chapters,
one should extensively distinguish them.
Question: Why compose this treatise?
Answer: In order to stop other schools and manifest one's own meaning.
Namely, the allegorists say:
Contact does not really exist.
Why is it so?ğŸ”½Because it is said in the sÅ«tras.
As the sÅ«tras say:ğŸ”½...
Eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness.
The union of the three is contact, and so on.
Apart from eye, form, and eye consciousness, a real substance of contact cannot be found.
To refute that view, it is shown that the substance of contact really exists.
If the substance of contact did not really exist,
it would contradict the sÅ«tra's statement.
As a sÅ«tra says:
Contact serves as a condition for feeling.
If there were no contact, it would only say that the six sense bases serve as a condition for feeling.
Or it would say that feeling has no condition, and should not say that contact serves as a condition for feeling.
Moreover, if the substance of contact did not really exist,
it would only say that dependent arising has eleven members.
The sÅ«tra should not say that there are twelve.
Moreover, if the substance of contact did not really exist,
it would only say that there are nine universal mental factors.
But since it says there are ten, contact really exists.
Question: If contact really exists, how do you explain that sÅ«tra passage?
Answer: That sÅ«tra means that the union of three dharmas as conditions gives rise to contact. It does not mean that what lacks substance can have the meaning of arising.
If it does not arise, how can it be a condition for feeling?
It is like the moon, the moon-loving jewel,
and the combination of vessels giving rise to water as a condition.
Without the arising of water, water can be used.
Again, it is like the sun, the sun-loving jewel,
and the combination of grains and firewood giving rise to fire as a condition.
Without the arising of fire, fire can be used.
In the same way, the combination of faculties, objects, and consciousness gives rise to contact as a condition, and without the arising of contact, contact can be used.
The use of contact refers to being able to give rise to feeling as a condition.
Therefore, in order to refute others and show that contact really exists, this treatise is composed.
Question: Why does the aggregate of faculties distinguish contact?
Answer: Because the author of the treatise wishes it to be so, and so on.
Moreover, this should not be asked.
Why is it so?
Because it has already been said that each aggregate contains all meanings.
Moreover, all dharmas arise from the accumulation of contact.
Because the faculties arise from contact, contact is distinguished.
Moreover, the reason why mind and mental factors are called contact is because they are the life of contact.
Because of the power of contact that is drawn out and transformed by contact, it manifests in the present. Because there is a faculty in this, it is distinguished as contact.
Furthermore, after first establishing the various contacts, then distinguishing the faculties that correspond to them.
Because the faculties take contact as their chapter, they should first be distinguished as contact.
Question: In the various holy teachings,
sometimes one contact is spoken of, like establishing the mental factor of contact among the mental factors,
or establishing contact as a great ground dharma among the ten great ground dharmas.
Sometimes two contacts are spoken of, namely contaminated and uncontaminated, bound and liberated, bound and unbound.
Sometimes three contacts are spoken of,
namely inferior, middling, and superior, wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate.
Sometimes four contacts are spoken of,
namely bound to the three realms and unbound.
Sometimes five contacts are spoken of,
namely bound to the three realms and learner and post-learner.
Sometimes six contacts are spoken of,
namely eye contact up to mind contact.
Sometimes seven contacts are spoken of,
namely those eliminated by seeing suffering,
up to those eliminated by cultivation,
and learner and post-learner. Sometimes eight contacts are spoken of,
That is, those eliminated by seeing suffering, up to those eliminated by cultivation,
and those eliminated by the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no-more-learning.
Or it is said that there are nine kinds of contact, from the lowest of the low up to the highest of the high.
Or it is said that there are ten kinds of contact.
That is, those belonging to the desire realm,
up to those belonging to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and those unattached.
If distinguished by continuity and moment, there are innumerable [kinds of contact].
Why is it that here, for one [kind of contact], it is explained in detail as sixteen,
and for innumerable [kinds of contact], it is explained in brief as sixteen?
The answer is: for six reasons, neither in brief nor in detail, sixteen kinds of contact are explained.
That is, due to the object,
due to obstruction and treatment, due to intrinsic nature,
due to opposition and conformity, due to association, and due to the basis.
Due to the object, contact with resistance and contact with conceptualization are established.
Due to obstruction and treatment, contact with illumination and contact with ignorance are established.
Due to intrinsic nature, contact that is neither illuminating nor non-illuminating is established.
Due to opposition and conformity, contact with craving and contact with aversion are established.
Due to association, contact that accords with pleasant feeling is established.
Contact associated with pain and contact associated with neither-pain-nor-pleasure are established as eye contact up to mind contact based on the basis.
What is contact with resistance?
Answer: Contact associated with the five groups of consciousness.
Why is this contact called with resistance? It is because it takes resistant dharmas as its object.
Question: Contact associated with discursive thought also takes resistant dharmas as its object.
Why is this contact alone called with resistance?
Answer: This contact is called first, and contact associated with discursive thought is called later.
It is established based on other conditions.
Some say:
This contact only takes resistant dharmas as its object.
Contact associated with discursive thought also takes other dharmas as its object.
Some say:
The basis and object of this contact are both resistant.
Although the object of contact associated with discursive thought may be resistant, its basis is not, so it is established with a separate name.
What is contact associated with discursive thought?
Answer: Contact associated with the group of mental consciousness. Question: Why is this contact called with discursive thought?
Answer: Because this contact is characterized by language, it is called with linguistic expression.
Question: How is this contact characterized by language?
Answer: Resistant contact is only bound to the desire realm and form realm.
This contact is bound to the three realms and is also unbound.
Moreover, resistant contact is only in the desire realm.
It can be obtained in the first dhyÄna stage.
This contact can be obtained in all stages.
Moreover, resistant contact is only contaminated.
This contact is both contaminated and uncontaminated.
For these reasons, it is characterized by language.
Some say:
This contact is called with linguistic expression because its object is language.
Question: How is the object of this contact characterized by language?
Answer: Resistant contact only takes form as its object.
This contact takes both form and formlessness as its object.
Moreover, resistant contact only takes resistant dharmas as its object.
This contact takes both resistant and non-resistant as its object.
Moreover, resistant contact only takes contaminated dharmas as its object.
This contact takes both contaminated and uncontaminated as its object.
Moreover, resistant contact only takes conditioned dharmas as its object, while this contact can universally take conditioned and unconditioned dharmas as its object.
For these reasons, the term with discursive thought is added.
Some say:
Discursive thought refers to names. This contact is called with discursive thought because it takes names as its object.
Although it also takes meanings as its object, it is not common to all.
Therefore, the name is established according to the uncommon aspect, while the general name is established according to the common aspect.
Like the knowledge of suffering and accumulation, etc.
What is clear contact?
The answer is: Uncontaminated contact is contact associated with the three uncontaminated faculties.
What is ignorance contact?
The answer is: Defiled contact is contact associated with all afflictions and secondary afflictions.
What is neither clear nor unclear contact?
The answer is: Undefiled contaminated contact.
Here, each question and answer has two negations.ğŸ”½Neither clear negates clear contact.
Nor unclear negates ignorance contact.ğŸ”½Undefiled negates defiled contact.
Contaminated negates uncontaminated contact.
Because of this exclusion, its substance includes only all contaminated wholesome and non-obscuring-non-defined contacts.
What is the contact of craving?
Answer: The contact associated with craving.
It is the contact associated with craving that accompanies the six consciousnesses to be eliminated in the three realms and the five categories.
What is the contact of aversion?
Answer: The contact associated with aversion.
It is the contact associated with aversion that accompanies the six consciousnesses to be eliminated in the five [categories].
What is the contact that is conducive to the experience of pleasure?
Answer: The contact associated with the experience of pleasure.
It is the contact associated with the faculties of pleasure and joy.
What is the contact that is conducive to the experience of pain?
Answer: The contact associated with the experience of pain.
It is the contact associated with the faculties of pain and sorrow.
What is the contact that is conducive to the experience of neither pleasure nor pain?
Answer: The contact associated with the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.
It is the contact associated with the faculty of equanimity.
What is eye contact?
Answer: The contact associated with the eye consciousness.
Up to what is mind contact?
Answer: The contact associated with the mind consciousness. It is called eye, etc. contact because it arises in dependence on the eye, etc. faculties.
Having explained its intrinsic nature, we will now discuss its inclusion.
However, there is one type of contact that includes all contacts.
Namely, the intrinsic nature of contact among mental factors.
Here, two types of contact include all contacts.
Namely, contact with resistance and contact with conceptualization. There are also three types of contact that include all contacts.
Namely, contact with knowledge, contact with ignorance,
and contact that is neither with knowledge nor ignorance.
And contact that accords with pleasant, painful, and neither-pleasant-nor-painful feelings.
There are also six types of contact that include all contacts.
Namely, eye contact up to mind contact.
Question: How many types of contact are included in contact with resistance?
Up to how many types of contact are included in mind contact?
Answer: Contact with resistance includes six types of contact in their entirety and a part of seven types of contact.
The six in their entirety are:
Contact with resistance, eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body contact.
The part of seven is:
Contact with ignorance, neither with knowledge nor ignorance,
contact with craving and aversion,ğŸ”½contact that accords with pleasant, painful,
and neither-pleasant-nor-painful feelings.
Question: How does this include seven of the seven contacts?
Answer: Those seven are all associated with the six consciousnesses.
This only includes those associated with the five consciousnesses, therefore it is said to be a part.
The contact of discursive thought includes all three contacts,
And a part of the seven contacts.
The three complete ones are:
The contact of discursive thought, the contact of understanding, and the contact of the mind.
The part of the seven is as explained above.
Question: How does this include seven of the seven contacts?
Answer: Those seven are all associated with the six consciousnesses.
This only includes those associated with the mental consciousness, therefore it is said to be a part.
The contact of understanding includes all the contact of understanding,
And a part of the four contacts.
Namely, the contact of discursive thought,
The contact that accords with pleasant, painful, and neither-pleasant-nor-painful feelings, and the contact of the mind.
Question: How does this include four of the four contacts?
Answer: Those four are both contaminated and uncontaminated.
This only includes the uncontaminated, therefore it is said to be a part.
The contact of ignorance includes all three contacts,
And a part of the eleven contacts.
The three complete ones are:
Namely, the contact of ignorance, the contact of craving, and the contact of aversion.
Eleven parts means
namely, the contact of resistance and expression.
The contact that accords with pleasant, painful, and neither-unpleasant-nor-painful feelings.
The contact of the eye, and so on up to the contact of the mind.
Question: How does this include eleven parts of that?
Answer: Those eleven are both defiled and undefiled.
This only includes the defiled, therefore it is said to be a part.
The contact that is neither clear nor unclear
includes the contact that is neither clear nor unclear in its entirety.
Eleven contacts in part.
Namely, as explained above.
Question: How does this include eleven parts of that?
Answer: Those eleven are both defiled and undefiled.
The undefiled are both contaminated and uncontaminated.
This only includes the contaminated undefiled, therefore it is said to be a part.
The contact of craving includes the contact of craving in its entirety.
Eleven contacts in part.
Namely, the contact of resistance and expression.
The contact of ignorance.
The contact that accords with pleasant and neither-unpleasant-nor-painful feelings.
Eye contact up to mind contact.
Question: How does this include part of those eleven?
Answer: Those eleven are both associated with and not associated with craving.
This only includes those that are associated, therefore it is said to be part.
The contact of anger includes the entire contact of anger.
And part of the eleven contacts.
Namely, the contacts of obstruction and verbal expression.
The contact of ignorance.
The contacts of leading to suffering and to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.
Eye contact up to mind contact.
Question: How does this include part of those eleven?
Answer: Those eleven are both associated with and not associated with hatred.
This only includes those that are associated, therefore it is said to be part.
The contact of leading to pleasant feeling includes the entire contact of leading to pleasant feeling.
And part of the twelve contacts.
Namely, the contacts of obstruction and verbal expression.
Knowledge and ignorance.
The contacts of neither-knowledge-nor-ignorance and craving.
Eye contact up to mind contact.
Question: How does this include part of those twelve?
Answer: Those twelve are both associated with and not associated with the feeling of pleasure.
This only includes those that are associated, therefore it is said to be a part.
Contact that is favorable to the feeling of pain includes all contact that is favorable to the feeling of pain,
And eleven kinds of contact in part.
Namely, contact that is resistant and that which has verbal expression.
Ignorance.
Contact that is neither clear nor unclear.
Contact of anger, contact of the eye, up to contact of the mind.
Question: How does this include those eleven in part?
Answer: Those eleven are both associated with and not associated with the feeling of pain.
This only includes those that are associated, therefore it is said to be a part.
Contact that is favorable to the feeling of neither pain nor pleasure,
Includes all contact that is favorable to the feeling of neither pain nor pleasure,
And thirteen kinds of contact in part.
Namely, contact that is resistant and that which has verbal expression, contact that is clear, contact that is unclear,
Contact that is neither clear nor unclear, contact of craving, contact of anger,
Contact of the eye, up to contact of the mind.
Question: How does this include those thirteen in part?
Answer: Those thirteen are both associated with and not associated with the feeling of equanimity.
This only includes those that arise together, so it is said to be a small portion.
Eye contact includes all eye contact,
and a small portion of eight contacts.
Namely, resistant contact,
ignorance,
contact that is neither clear nor unclear,
contact of love and aversion,ğŸ”½contact that accords with pleasure, suffering,
and neither pleasure nor suffering.
How does this include a small portion of those eight?
The answer is: those eight are common to being associated or not associated with eye consciousness.
This only includes those that are associated, so it is said to be a small portion.
As with eye contact,
ear, nose, tongue, and body contact are also like this.
The difference is:
each includes its own contact in its entirety,
and a small portion of the eight associated with its own consciousness.
Mental contact includes three contacts in their entirety,
and a small portion of seven contacts.
As with contact associated with ideation,
Why is it called inclusion? What is the meaning of inclusion?
The answer is: the essence of something already exists, will exist, or currently exists in its own essence, so it is called inclusion.
Some say:
The self-nature of a dharma is neither different nor external nor distinct nor separate from that dharma.
Because it exists and is not empty, it is called included.
Some say:
The self-nature of a dharma
is not that it did not exist in the past,ğŸ”½is not that it does not exist in the present,
and is not that it will not exist in the future.
Therefore, it is called included.
The meaning of dharmas not abandoning their own nature is the meaning of included.
It is not like using a finger to pinch cloth,
or using a hand to pick up food,
because those can be abandoned.
Some say:
The meaning of obstruction is the meaning of included.
There is no obstruction of dharmas like the self-nature of a dharma to that dharma.
How many faculties are associated with the contact of resistance,
up to how many faculties are associated with the contact of the mind?
The answer is: The contact of resistance is associated with one entire
and a part of eight faculties.
The one entire one is
the faculty of pain.
The part of eight is
the faculties of mind, joy, equanimity, and the five beginning with faith.
The question is: How is it associated with a part of those eight?
Answer: Those eight faculties are associated with the six consciousnesses.
This is only associated with the five consciousnesses, therefore it is said to be a small part.
The contact of conceptualization is associated with all five faculties.
And a small part of eight faculties.
The five complete ones are:
The three faculties of joy, sorrow, and the three without outflows.
The eight small parts are as explained above.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those eight?
Answer: Those eight faculties are associated with the six consciousnesses.
This is only associated with the sixth consciousness, therefore it is said to be a small part.
The contact of clarity.
It is associated with three faculties in their entirety.
And a small part of nine faculties.
The three complete ones are:
The three faculties without outflows.
The nine small parts are:
The faculties of intention, joy, equanimity, faith, etc.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those nine?
Answer: Those nine faculties are both with outflows and without outflows.
This is only associated with the without outflows, therefore it is said to be a small part. The contact of ignorance.
It is associated with a small part of the six faculties.
Namely, the mental faculty and the five faculties of sensation.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those six?
Answer: Those six faculties are both defiled and undefiled.
This is only associated with the defiled, therefore it is said to be a small part.
Neither-painful-nor-pleasant contact.
It is associated with a small part of eleven faculties.
Namely, the mental faculty, the five faculties of faith, etc.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those eleven?
Answer: Among those eleven faculties, the first six are both defiled and undefiled.
The last five are both contaminated and uncontaminated.
This is only associated with the undefiled and contaminated, therefore it is said to be a small part.
Craving contact.
It is associated with a small part of four faculties.
Namely, the mental faculty, the faculties of joy, pleasure, and equanimity.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those four?
Answer: Those four faculties are both associated with and not associated with the arising of craving.
This is only associated with that which is associated with the arising of craving, therefore it is said to be a small part. Hostility contact.
It is associated with a small part of four faculties.
Namely, the mental faculty, the faculty of suffering, the faculty of sorrow, and the faculty of equanimity.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those four?
Answer: Those four faculties are both associated with and not associated with anger.
This is only associated with those that are associated, therefore it is said to be a small part.
Contact that is in accordance with the faculty of pleasure.
Two faculties are completely associated.
Nine faculties are partially associated.
The two complete ones are:
Namely, the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of joy.
The nine partial ones are:
Namely, the mental faculty, faith and the other five faculties, and the three pure faculties.
Question: How is this associated with a small part of those nine?
Answer: Among those nine faculties, the first six are both associated with and not associated with the faculty of pleasure.
This is only associated with those that are associated.
The last three have the nine faculties as their nature.
This is only associated with the six faculties, therefore it is said to be a small part.
Contact that is in accordance with the faculty of suffering.
Two faculties are completely associated. Six faculties are partially associated.
The two complete ones are:
Namely, the faculty of suffering and the faculty of sorrow.
The six partial ones are:
Namely, the mental faculty, faith and the other five faculties.
What is the question about?
This is partially associated with those six.
The answer is: those six faculties are partially associated with the arising of the feeling of pain, and partially not associated with it.
This is only associated with those that arise together, therefore it is said to be partially associated.
The contact that accords with the feeling of neither-pain-nor-pleasure,
one entire faculty,
and nine faculties partially associated.
The one entire [faculty] is
the faculty of equanimity.
The nine partial [faculties] are
the mental faculty, faith and the other five faculties, and the three pure faculties.
The question is: how is this partially associated with those nine?
The answer is: among those nine faculties, the first six
are partially associated with the arising of the feeling of neither-pain-nor-pleasure, and partially not associated with it.
This is only associated with those that arise together.
The last three have the nine faculties as their nature.
This is only associated with the six faculties, therefore it is said to be partially associated.
Eye contact is partially associated with nine faculties,
namely the mental faculty, the faculties of pleasure, pain, and equanimity, and the five faculties beginning with faith.
The question is: how is this partially associated with those nine?
Answer: Those nine faculties are associated with both the category arising together with eye-consciousness and the category not arising together with it.
This [eye-contact] is only associated with the category arising together with it, therefore it is said to be a part.
Like eye-contact.
Ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-contact are also like this.
The difference among them is:
Each is associated with the faculties arising together with its own consciousness.
Mind-contact.
Is associated with five faculties in their entirety and a part of eight faculties.
Like the contact associated with conceptualization is explained.
The meaning of association is explained in detail above.
The faculties that are causes of resistant contact,
are these faculties associated with resistant contact?
If the faculties are associated with resistant contact,
are these faculties causes of resistant contact?
Answer: The faculties that are associated with resistant contact,
these faculties are causes of resistant contact.
That is to say, these faculties take resistant contact as four causes:
The causes of association, co-existence, the same type, and karmic retribution.
There are faculties that are causes of resistant contact,
but these faculties are not associated with resistant contact.
It means the faculties that are associated with resistant contact and other contacts.
And those that are born from karmic ripening and have no objects.ğŸ”½As for associated with other contacts,
it means those associated with contact with conceptualization.
This faculty
has resistant contact as two causes.
Namely, the homogeneous cause and the karmic ripening cause.
As for those born from karmic ripening and have no objects,
it means the eight faculties such as life.
This faculty has resistant contact as one cause.
Namely, the karmic ripening cause.
The faculties that have contact with conceptualization as their cause,
are these faculties associated with contact with conceptualization?
If the faculties are associated with contact with conceptualization,
do these faculties have contact with conceptualization as their cause?
The answer is: The faculties that are associated with contact with conceptualization have contact with conceptualization as their cause.
This faculty has contact with conceptualization as five causes.
Namely, the associated cause, the co-existent cause, the homogeneous cause, the universal cause, and the karmic ripening cause.
There are faculties that have contact with conceptualization as their cause,
but these faculties are not associated with contact with conceptualization.
It means the faculties that have contact with conceptualization as their cause but are associated with other contacts.
And those arisen from karmic ripening have no objects.
The remaining ones associated with contact.
That is, associated with resistant contact.
This faculty has three causes for the contact of discursive speech.
That is, the homogeneous cause, the universal cause, and the cause of karmic ripening.
And those arisen from karmic ripening have no objects.
That is, the eight faculties such as life.
This faculty has one cause for the contact of discursive speech.
That is, the cause of karmic ripening.
If a faculty is caused by bright contact, is that faculty associated with bright contact?
Answer: It is so.
If a faculty is associated with bright contact, is that faculty caused by bright contact?
Answer: It is so.
Here, the cause refers to
the three causes, namely the associated cause, the co-existent cause, and the homogeneous cause.
The faculties caused by contact with ignorance.
Are those faculties associated with contact with ignorance?
If a faculty is associated with contact with ignorance,
is that faculty caused by contact with ignorance?
Answer: The faculties associated with contact with ignorance,
those faculties are caused by contact with ignorance.
It means that this faculty takes ignorance-contact as four causes.
Namely, the associated, co-existent, homogeneous, and omnipresent causes.
There are faculties that take ignorance-contact as a cause, but this faculty is not associated with ignorance-contact.
It means that the faculty takes ignorance-contact as a cause, but is associated with other contacts.
And those that are born from karmic ripening and have no object.
Associated with other contacts means
associated with neither-bright-nor-dark contact.
This faculty takes ignorance-contact as one cause, namely the cause of karmic ripening.
And those born from karmic ripening and have no object means
the eight faculties such as life.
This faculty takes ignorance-contact as one cause, namely the cause of karmic ripening.
The faculties that take neither-bright-nor-dark contact as a cause,
are these faculties not associated with neither-bright-nor-dark contact?
If a faculty is not associated with neither-bright-nor-dark contact,

The answer is: The faculties that are not associated with neither-bright-nor-dark contact,
this faculty takes neither-bright-nor-dark contact as a cause.
That is, this faculty takes non-illuminating and non-non-illuminating contact as four causes.
Namely, the associated, co-existent, homogeneous, and karmic maturation causes.
There are faculties that take non-illuminating and non-non-illuminating contact as causes.
These faculties are not associated with non-illuminating and non-non-illuminating contact.
That is, the faculties take non-illuminating and non-non-illuminating contact as causes.
Karmic maturation-born, without objects.
That is, the eight faculties such as life.
Taking non-illuminating and non-non-illuminating contact as one cause.
Namely, the karmic maturation cause.
For those faculties that take craving contact as causes, are these faculties associated with craving contact?
If the faculties are associated with craving contact,
do these faculties take craving contact as causes?
The answer is: Those faculties that are associated with craving contact take craving contact as causes.
That is, these faculties take craving contact as three causes.
Namely, the associated, co-existent, and homogeneous causes.
There are faculties that take craving contact as causes.
These faculties are not associated with craving contact.
That is, the faculties take craving contact as causes.

The remaining contacts associated with ignorance.
Contacts associated with neither-illumination-nor-non-illumination.
This faculty has craving contact as two causes:
The homogeneous cause and the ripening cause.
The remaining contacts associated with ignorance.
The faculty has craving contact as the homogeneous cause.
Contacts associated with neither-illumination-nor-non-illumination.
The faculty has craving contact as the ripening cause.

The faculties that are causes of contact associated with pleasant feeling.
Are these faculties associated with contact associated with pleasant feeling?
If the faculties are associated with contact associated with pleasant feeling,
are these faculties causes of contact associated with pleasant feeling?
The faculties that are associated with contact associated with pleasant feeling,ğŸ”½these faculties are causes of contact associated with pleasant feeling.

It refers to the five such as association.

This faculty is not associated with contact that is conducive to pleasant feeling.
It refers to a faculty that takes as its cause contact that is conducive to pleasant feeling.
It is associated with other types of contact.
And it is a non-associated formative factor that arises from the karmic maturation of contact that is conducive to pleasant feeling.
Associated with other types of contact refers to contact that is conducive to painful feeling.
It is associated with contact that is conducive to neither painful nor pleasant feeling.
This faculty takes as its three causes contact that is conducive to pleasant feeling.

And it is a non-associated formative factor that arises from the karmic maturation of contact that is conducive to pleasant feeling.

The difference is that
one's own name is mentioned for each faculty.
If a faculty takes eye contact as its cause, is this faculty associated with eye contact?
If a faculty is associated with eye contact,
does this faculty take eye contact as its cause?
Answer: Those faculties associated with eye contact.
These faculties have eye contact as their cause.
That is, these faculties have eye contact as four causes:
namely, the associated cause, co-existent cause, homogeneous cause, and ripening cause.
There are faculties that have eye contact as their cause.
These faculties are not associated with eye contact.
That is, the faculties that have eye contact as their cause but are associated with other contacts,
and those that are ripening and have no object.
Associated with other contacts means
associated with ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contacts.
These faculties have eye contact as two causes:
namely, the homogeneous cause and ripening cause.
And those that are ripening and have no object means
the eight faculties such as life.
These faculties have eye contact as one cause, namely the ripening cause.
As it is said for eye contact,
ear, nose, tongue, and body contacts are also like this.
The difference is:
one's own name is mentioned.
If the faculties have mind contact as their cause, are these faculties associated with mind contact?
If the faculties are associated with mind contact,
do these faculties have mind contact as their cause?
Answer: Those faculties that are associated with mental contact.
These faculties take mental contact as their cause.
That is to say, these faculties take mental contact as five causes,
namely the five of association and so forth.
There are faculties that take mental contact as their cause,
but these faculties are not associated with mental contact.
That is to say, faculties that take mental contact as their cause,
but are associated with other contacts,
and those that are born of retribution and have no objects.
Associated with other contacts refers to those associated with eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body contacts.
These faculties take mental contact as three causes,
namely the causes of the same type, the universal, and retribution.
And those that are born of retribution and have no objects refers to the eight faculties such as life.
These faculties take mental contact as one cause, namely the cause of retribution.
Those who have attained this type of eye faculty,
have they attained this type of body faculty?
And so on, it is explained in detail.
There are four types of classes:
1. The class of cultivation,
2. The class of precepts,
3. The class of realms,
4. The class of similarity.
These four are explained in detail as before in the aggregate of karma.
Here, the treatise is composed based on the classification of realms.
Those who possess this type of eye faculty,
do they possess this type of body faculty?
If they possess this type of body faculty,
do they possess this type of eye faculty?
The answer is: Four sentences should be made.
There are those who possess this type of eye faculty but not this type of body faculty.
Namely, those born in the desire realm who have not obtained the eye faculty.
Even if obtained, it has been lost.
Obtaining the eye faculty of the form realm but not possessing the eye faculty.
Namely, those who have not yet reached the stage of prÄtimoká¹£a and so forth.
Even if obtained, it has been lost.
Namely, those who have already obtained the eye faculty.
Either it naturally deteriorates,
or it is lost due to encountering conditions.
Obtaining the eye faculty of the form realm.
Namely, due to the power of well-cultivating meditative absorption,
the eye faculty of the form realm is obtained based on the body of the desire realm.
But one does not obtain the body faculty of that realm.
Because one does not possess the body of another realm.
There are those who possess this type of body faculty,
It is not this type of eye faculty.
It refers to those born in the desire realm who have not obtained the eye faculty,
or even if they have obtained it, have already lost it.
Those who have not obtained the eye faculty of the form realm only possess the body faculty of the desire realm.
They do not possess either the eye faculty of the two realms.
There are those who possess this type of eye faculty and also this type of body faculty.
It refers to those born in the desire realm who have obtained the eye faculty and have not lost it.
If born in the form realm, those who have already obtained it
refer to those who have already reached the stage of kalala and so on.
Those who have not lost it
refer to the eye faculty that has been obtained and is not naturally destroyed.
And because it is not lost due to encountering conditions that destroy it.
Because those born in the form realm do not have any faculties that are incomplete.
There are those who do not possess this type of eye faculty,
and also do not possess this type of body faculty.
It refers to those born in the formless realm.
Because that realm definitely does not have any material faculties.
Just like the eye faculty,
the ear faculty is also like this.
These two both have the manifestation of different realms.
Those who possess this type of nose faculty,
Do they possess this type of body faculty?
If they possess this type of body faculty,
do they possess this type of nose faculty?
The answer is: If they possess this type of nose faculty,
they possess this type of body faculty.
There are those who possess this type of body faculty
but do not possess this type of nose faculty.
Namely, those born in the desire realm who have not obtained the nose faculty,
or who have obtained it but have lost it.
Those who have not obtained the nose faculty
refer to those who have not yet reached the stage of prÄÅ›Äkha.
Those who have obtained it but have lost it
refer to those who have obtained the nose faculty
but it has naturally deteriorated,
or has deteriorated due to encountering conditions.
Like the nose faculty,
the tongue faculty is also like this.
These two are both without the present manifestation of a different realm.
Why is it that when born in the desire realm, the eye and ear faculties of the form realm can be manifested,
but not the nose, tongue, and body faculties?
The answer is: Because the two faculties of eye and earğŸ”½are obtained through practice,
and are obtained through detachment.
The cultivated.
Because the four and five branches of dhyÄna are the fruits of the cultivated.
One can attain and manifest them in other realms.
The nose, tongue, and body faculties do not have such things.
Therefore, they can only manifest in their own realms.
Other masters say:
Those born in the desire realm who seek to manifest the heavenly eye and ear faculties of the upper realms.
Do not seek the other three, so they cannot manifest.
That is to say, the contemplator makes this aspiration:
How can I see the forms of the form realm?
Hear the sounds of the form realm?
Because of this, they cultivate the fundamental dhyÄna and manifest the heavenly eye and ear.
They have no smells and tastes to desire to smell and taste, so
They do not seek to manifest the form realm nose and tongue.
There is no birth in different realms or the perception of different realms.
Even if they seek it there, there is no reason to manifest it.
Because it only takes the objects that reach it.
Question: What is the essence of the heavenly eye?
Answer: It is not composed of sinews, bones, blood, or flesh.
It is pure form created by the primary elements of the form realm.
The substance of unobstructed vision cannot be seen.
The eye element, eye base, and eye faculty are included in the divine eye.
Having explained its essence, we will now explain its name.
Question: For what causes and conditions is it called the divine eye?
Answer: This eye is superior, therefore it is called divine.
Because the world has the word heaven for superior dharmas.
It is said that heavenly garments, heavenly ornaments, and heavenly food and drink, etc.
Here, all are called heavenly because of their superiority.
This is also like that.
The realm is bound to the form realm.
The stage is in the four meditations.
Not in the neighboring stages or formless [absorptions].
Why is this so?
If a stage has the superior concentration that is the basis for spiritual powers,
that stage has the divine eye.
The neighboring stages and formless [absorptions] do not have the superior concentration that is the basis for spiritual powers.

Therefore, those stages do do not have the divine eye.ğŸ”½Question: Why do the neighboring stages and formless [absorptions] not have the superior concentration that is the basis for spiritual powers?
Answer: Because Å›amatha and vipaÅ›yanÄ are not equal.
Because it is not composed of five or four branches.
Because it is not included in the path of joy.
Question: If one born in the desire realm cultivates and attains the divine eye,
when it is present, where does it arise?
Answer: It arises where the innate eye is.
Question: If the innate eye is damaged, where does it arise?
Answer: It arises where there was once an eye.
Question: If that place is combined into one section,
and is imperceptible, where does it arise again?
Answer: It arises where there should be an eye.
Question: As for those who give rise to the divine eye and make it present,
is there a case where the left eye arises but the right eye does not arise?
Is there a case where the right eye arises but the left eye does not arise?ğŸ”½Is the left eye inferior and the right eye middling?
Is the left eye middling and the right eye superior?ğŸ”½Is the right eye inferior and the left eye middling?
Is the right eye middling and the left eye superior?
Answer: It does not arise in this way. One who gives rise to the divine eye necessarily gives rise to eyes in both places,
equal in inferiority, equal in middling, and equal in superiority.
All divine eyes are without blindness or deficiency.
There is also no dizziness or similar states.
If one is born in the desire realm and transforms a body of 16,800 yojanas in the highest form realm,
when the divine eye is manifest and observes that form,
the human body is three and a half cubits long,
or four cubits, and still does not reach the tip of the toe.
In what place does one abide and observe that form?
Is it above or below?
Some say:
Abiding above with the supernormal knowledge of spiritual powers, one sees.ğŸ”½Like a builder observing from above,
so does one observe the various forms below while dwelling above.
Some say:
Abiding below and seeing, like a procession observer observing from below.
So does one observe the various forms above while dwelling below.
Some say:
At that time, with the supernormal knowledge of spiritual powers,
one extends and expands this body to the extent of the transformed body of 16,800 yojanas and observes the various forms.
Some say:
The desire realm also has a body of 16,800 yojanas.
They should be born together with the body of the highest form realm that is transformed.
When one transforms the body of the highest form realm,
at that time the body of the desire realm, three and a half or four cubits in size, immediately perishes.
The body of sixteen thousand yojanas continues to arise.
One observes various forms right where the eyes are, as usual.
According to this explanation,
the size of the transformed body is the same as the body of retribution when born in that realm.
When one comes from the form realm to the desire realm,
one transforms the transformed body to be the same size as the body of retribution in the desire realm.
One should know that this is the same when creating that body.
